intro: Tephrosia brachyodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Tephrosia brachyodon is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
